column3: 一度、会いましょう
column5: Once, meet lets.

column3: 一位はアメリカ人でした
column5: First place, American was.

column3: 僕は世界で一番弱い
column4: I'm the weakest person in the world
column5: I, world in, the first weak

column3: 答えを一つ選びます
column5: Answer, one choose
column6: Infinitive form: BU conjugted to BI

column3: お一人さま一つ限りです
column4: It's limited to one per customer
column5: Customer one thing limit.

column3: 昨日、一つめこぞうに合った
column4: Yesterday, I met a one eyed goblin.
column5: Yesterday, one eyed goblin met.
column6: に: Object of verb - The difference between に and を cannot be defined clearly. However, it is said that if the verb has a nuance of direction or motion, the particle should be に. When it comes to “to meet” and “to kiss”, imaginatively speaking, you would move toward him or her.

column3: 一人でカラオケに行きました
column5: By alone to karaoke went
column6:
で in this context is meansで destinationに verb. I.e. the means in which you verb to destiation.
Infinitive form: KU conjugated to KI

column3: 一人はアメリカ人です
column5: One person, American is.

column3: むすめは、今日初めて一人でお使いに行きました
column4: My daughter did the errands by herself for the first time today
column5: Daughter, today first time alone errands went (to go do)
column6: で in this context is meansで destinationに verb.

column3: 明日の朝、七時に駅で会いませんか
column4: Why don't we met at the station at seven tomorrow morning
column5: Today morning, at seven at the station meet why dont we
column6:
に as an indication of time
で as an indication of location
ませんか - Why don't (we)

column3: みかんが七こあります
column5: Orange seven exist
column6:
こ/個 is general counter for 3D things
あります is existance / to have

column3: 七人の小人と友たちになりたい
column4: I want to be friends with the seven dwarves
column5: Seven dwarves friends to become want
column6:
と here means with / together with
になりたい means want to become (breakdown: たい expresses desire to do verb, which is infinitive form. なる (to become) infinitive is なり. So we have なりたい means want to become. We add the に particle as a sense of direction towards something, in this case towards becoming friends.)

column3: 箱の中にりんごが七つあります
column4: There are seven apples in a box
column5: In the box's inside apple seven there are.
column6:
に - in the box's inside (箱の中)
りんごが七つ: The ordering of noun-ga/wo number-counter is more natural. Generally ga is used for static verbs (e.g. exists) and wo for action verbs (e.g. eat)
あります is existance / to have

column3: 二人でメロンを七つ食べました
column5: (by using) Two people, melon seven ate.
column6:
で here marks something that is used to complete an action
wo is used instead of ga because verb is action verb (eat)
The ordering of noun-ga/wo number-counter is more natural

column3: 七つ数えると、私は女になる
column4: After I count to seven, I will be a woman.
column5: seven count (if, then), I woman (towards) become.
column6:
と particle used here in the if/then format: [Condition] + と + [Result].
になる means to become.

column3: この問題用紙は、全部で三頁あります
column5: (Considering these) question papers, in all (zenbude) three pages there are.
column6:
全部で essentially means in all / in total.
あります is existance / to have

column3: 私は三十二才です
三回回ってワンと吠える
column4: Turn around three times and bark
column5: Three times, turn around, WOOF and bark.
column6:
Te-form 回る->回って
と here means and.
Not sure why ワン is used here

column3: 三つのせんたくしが音声で聞こえます
column5: Three choices (by) voice are hearable.
column6:
せんたくし means choices
が here is subject particle
音声 means voices/speech
で here is means by which the verb is executed (i.e. hearable by a voice).

column3: ここにボールを三つ入れてください
column4: Please put three balls in here
column5: (in) here balls three put in please.
column6:
に location particle
を instead of ga because action verb
入れる->入れて te form means put in or insert.

column3: 三つモカにかまれた
column5: Three mosquitos (went and) bited
column6:
モカ - mosquitos
に Object of Verb. Usually, if the verb has a nuance of direction or motion, the particle should be に.
かまれる(will be bitten/will bite)->かまれた(was bitten)
